page.title: 20SUMMARY
page.content: The information describing North Leverton was obtained from approx. 70 children/adults, mostly during school lessons. The LIFE-STYLE entry was written by 10 year old children. The village of 800, live in modern houses and work in modern conditions in the Trent side Power Stations or on farms. Farming is highly mechanised, using large fields, growing mainly cereals. Factory farming for eggs has replaced the hens in the back yard or orchard. There is no commercial centre in the village because most of the shopping is done at surrounding towns. The windmill grinds corn which is sold as flour to the thousands of visitors who enjoy watching the working mill. The mill is supported by the Friends of Leverton Windmill.
